title: 2005 (S.I. No. 60 of 2005)) of the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of
heading: 2. The Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (Public Service Obligations) Order
text_raw:
2. The Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (Public Service Obligations) Order 
2002 (S.I. No. 217 of 2002) is amended by the insertion of the following 
Article after Article 21: 

“Public service obligation on the transmission system operator 

There shall be imposed by the Commission on the transmission

title: 2005 (S.I. No. 60 of 2005)) of the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of
heading: system operator a requirement to make such arrangements as are
text_raw:
22. 
system operator a requirement to make such arrangements as are 
necessary to administer a competitive process, established by the 
Minister, to ensure that, in any specified period, there shall be available 
to a supplier electricity from generating stations which use as their 
primary fuel source renewable, sustainable or alternative forms of 
energy.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
 “Iris Oifigiúil” of 3rd March, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [56] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 February 2020. 

RICHARD BRUTON 

Minister for Communications, Climate Action and 
Environment.

title: 2005 (S.I. No. 60 of 2005)) of the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

This Order modifies Statutory Instrument 217 of 2002, the principal order, 
dealing with the public service obligation on electricity consumers. This Order 
specifically updates the principal order in respect of the insertion of Article 22 
which provides for the imposition by the Commission of a Public Service 
Obligation on the transmission system operator regarding the administration of 
a competition established by the Minister. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [56] 5
